examples: Arabic is considered a very guttural language, with many harsh consonants.

definitions.definition: having a place of articulation towards the back of the mouth; in modern use, uvular , pharyngeal , or glottal ; in earlier or non-technical use, also including velar .
Of, relating to, or connected to the throat .
examples: guttural duct of the ear; guttural pouch infection

secondary_definitions: ( phonetics ) having a place of articulation towards the back of the mouth; in modern use, uvular , pharyngeal , or glottal ; in earlier or non-technical use, also including velar .
( medicine , anatomy ) Of, relating to, or connected to the throat .
